project_title: Corporate Fraud Detection Using Email Clustering
objective: To detect potential corporate fraud patterns using unsupervised machine learning on internal email communications by clustering emails based on their content.

columns.file: Path of the original email file
columns.message: The text content of the email message

steps.title: Introduction and Objective
steps.description: Define the project’s goal, background on Enron dataset, and fraud detection context.

steps.title: Data Loading and Initial Exploration
steps.description: Load the dataset using pandas, inspect rows and columns, and understand the structure of the email messages.

steps.title: Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
steps.description: Remove duplicates, nulls, and unnecessary columns like 'Unnamed: 0'. Create a new column for email length.

steps.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
steps.description: Analyze distribution of email lengths, frequency of communication, and any outliers.

steps.title: Feature Extraction using TF-IDF
steps.description: Convert text emails into numerical vectors using TF-IDF to extract meaningful word patterns.

steps.title: Clustering with KMeans
steps.description: Apply KMeans clustering to group emails based on textual similarity. Add the cluster label to each email.

steps.title: Visualization of Clusters
steps.description: Use WordCloud to visualize the most frequent terms in each cluster to understand the type of communication in each group.

steps.title: Interpretation and Analysis
steps.description: Interpret the clusters and identify possible fraud-related patterns or risky communication styles.

steps.title: Conclusion
steps.description: Summarize the insights and how clustering can be a powerful unsupervised tool for internal fraud monitoring.
